sanskrit_verse:
देवताऽतिथिभृत्यानां पितॄणामात्मनश्च यः ।
न निर्वपति पञ्चानामुच्छ्वसन्न स जीवति ॥ ३.७२॥
transliteration:
devatā'tithibhṛtyānāṁ pitṝṇāmātmanaśca yaḥ |
na nirvapati pañcānāmucchwasan sa jīvati || 3.72||
sph_interpretive_translation: He who does not offer oblations to the deities, guests, servants, ancestors, and the Self while breathing—lives indeed.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority as alignment with cosmic order
Causation through omission of dharmic duty
Capacity-based responsibility rooted in breath-sustained life
Restoration logic via reconnection to ritual and relational duties
Consciousness alignment through recognition of interdependent existence
executable_legal_axioms: IF (agent.is_alive == TRUE) AND (agent.omits_oblation.duty_types IN [deities, guests, servants, ancestors, self]) THEN (trigger.responsibility_assumption_protocol)
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that mere biological survival without fulfillment of core relational obligations constitutes a fundamental failure of dharma. The threshold of responsibility is not action alone but the conscious offering of sustenance to those constituting one's existential field. Authority lies in recognizing the breath as evidence of capacity, and thus, accountability.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that neglect of oblation disrupts causal harmony. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how omission cascades through relational fields. Proportional responsibility arises from breath-sustained presence. Non-punitive reality holds that correction occurs through reintegration, not penalty. Truth restores when offerings align consciousness.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Oblation Completion Process to reconnect agent with devas, guests, servants, ancestors, and Self
Deploy Consciousness Reawakening Protocol through rhythmic invocation and reciprocal acknowledgment
Assign Dharmic Mentorship to guide re-establishment of daily sacrificial practices
Activate Community Witnessing System to sustain renewed alignment
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands declared: Life without oblation is mere respiration; true living begins with conscious offering. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
